results.title: The Aid trap. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Chris Bryer, Derek Jones, Judith Weymont and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
Wealthy western nations in more recent times, have given aid to poorer nations struck by disasters such as famine, flood and war. The primary purpose of aid is to strengthen a political relationship between allies. Both parts of the video compare situations in Kerala and Bangladesh in terms of food distibution and programmes to prevent problems caused by overpopulation. At the time of production, food distribution in Bangladesh was hampered by corrupt political infra-structures in some areas, while education was not a high priority. In Kerala the effects of sound educational programmes and a fairer distribution of resources was examined.

results.title: Soldered spigot joint
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Tapering the end of the pipe with special tool, opening out with mandrel, use of coning tool for shaping, insertion of brass liner and application of solder. Recapitulation in diagram form.

results.title: Solder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Making a roof cesspool by another method, use of solder. Consideration of materials used. The solder itself, wiping cloths, plumbers’ black. Preparing the work for soldering; method of soldering; tools used.

group_siblings.title: Manufacture of sheet lead and lead pipes

results.title: Copper pipe bending
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Shows various methods of copper pipe bending in use. The steel spring; lead loading; machine bending; sand loading; use of compressors or rams; consolidation of sand; marking into pulls, heating, pulling and dressing.

results.title: Lead burning
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
The flat butted seam. Preparation, shaving the surfaces, adjustment of oxyacetylene flame, spot fusing. Actual burning operation with filler strip. Similar demonstration of flat-lapped seam, lapped seam on inclined plane and upright, vertical spigot joint and burned joint between tinned brass and lead.
results.description:

results.title: Copper sheet roofing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Softening of copper sheet by annealing; principle and method of joining sheets together by welting; single and double welts. Application to actual roofing: use of seaming pliers; making the upstand at wall end; fixing of sheets to roofboards with tacks or cleats; standing seams. Treatment at roof edge: cover piece and flashing at upstand end; another type of upstand to fit a corner in which there is an arris; use of pleating tool; the batten roll, joint, upstand and roll end.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.

results.title: Copper and bronze welding
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Autogenous welding, copper to copper, on heavy and light gauge tubes. Bronze welding: cup joint made with bronze filler strip first slowly and then at normal speed. Reducing joint: bronze welding copper tube to copper sheet. Alternative method: use of silver solder.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
